translations.translation: and then We would have cut off his life-blood
Then cut off his aorta,
and then severed his life vein;
and cut-off his main artery.
Then would have cut off his heart’s artery.
And then We certainly would have cut off Al-Watin from him,
Then We would certainly have cut off his aorta.
then We would surely have cut his life-vein
And then severed his life-artery,
and would indeed have cut his life-vein,
And then severed his life-vein.
and then cut off his aorta,
And We should certainly then cut off the artery of his heart:
And then certainly should have cut off his life artery (Aorta),
then, We would surely have cut from him the aorta (vein)
Then slashed his lifeline.
Then We would have cut from him the aorta.
[69:46] then We would have assuredly severed his life-artery, the aorta of the heart, a vein that connects with it, and which if severed results in that person’s death,
(And then severed his life artery) the life artery of Muhammad (pbuh)

commentaries.author: زيد بن علي
commentaries.text: { ثُمَّ لَقَطَعْنَا مِنْهُ ٱلْوَتِينَ } معناه نياطُ القَلبِ

translations.translation: {Then We cut off from him the two veins} The meaning is the niyat of the heart.

commentaries.author: الجيلاني
commentaries.text: { ثُمَّ لَقَطَعْنَا مِنْهُ } زجراً عليه، وتعذيباً له { ٱلْوَتِينَ } [الحاقة: 46] أي: نياط قلبه الذي منه عموم إدراكاته
